tool_description: Wikipedia search for factual, encyclopedic information with position-tracking for varied results

available_commands.description: Alias for query command - search Wikipedia

tool_usage_guidance: Use wiki_search for factual, encyclopedic information from Wikipedia
Search queries should be concise (1-3 words for best results)
Repeated searches on the same topic will return different content sections
Great for definitions, historical facts, scientific concepts, and biographical info
Returns contextual chunks containing query terms with smart positioning
proactive_triggers: When you're uncertain about facts or definitions
When you need historical or scientific information
When the user asks 'what is X' or 'who is X'
When your thoughts show curiosity about a topic
When you need to verify information before responding

metadata.notes: Position-tracking ensures varied results on repeated queries.
